prompt: GitHub Pages 'pages build and deployment' jobs sometimes show Cancelled (after ~17s) because a higher-priority build is waiting. As a maintainer, how should I interpret this and what minimal guardrails should I add so contributors are not confused?
claims: Cancelled runs can be normal when concurrency keeps only the latest deployment.
CI signals should minimize contributor confusion and avoid blocking merges on non-failures.
Prefer small, reversible changes: document behavior and adjust required checks before reworking the pipeline.
assumptions: At least one later Pages run completes successfully for the same branch.
We control repository settings and workflow configuration.
We want to keep GitHub Pages deployment lightweight.
open_questions: Is any branch protection requiring the cancelled check run to pass?
Do we need to disable 'cancel-in-progress' or just document it?
Should we trigger Pages builds only on push to main, or also on manual dispatch?
